reviews.title: It's fine
reviews.text: We had a great stay here...we were worried after the reviews but the hotel was clean, friendly and the breakfast was great. The hotel was no more noisy than many other city hotels and it was near to the trams, buses and canal bus. What were people complaining about?

I was really wary about staying here after reading some of the other reviews - but really happy i stayed at the Arena. I stayed in a standard room which was cleaned every morning. The staff were helpful and efficent. The only down sides was that the walls are paper thin and in the morning you can hear the cleaners and its about 30 minute walk into town or 10 euros to get into town by taxi which i didnt think was to bad (you can use the trams but we were to lazy!). Would stay here again!
reviews.title: nice and simple

reviews.text: x
reviews.title: In desperate need of rennovation and efficient staff!
Hotel Arena
reviews.text: I stayed at the Arena hotel for a long weekend. The hotel looks rather nice on the surface however, I was very disappointed once I had gotten inside. The room was in desperate need of a good clean - the floor was dirty and there was a thick layer of dust over everything. The bathroom floor was also filthy and there was no extractor fan which meant you could barely find yourself in the bathroom for steam!!!

reviews.title: Overrated, Overpriced
reviews.text: The reception staff were highly inefficent and on departure, we were quoted 3 different charges for our use of the restaurant and hotel. If I had not spoken up, the receptionist would quite happily have charged me an extra 100 euros due to their inefficiency!

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: Apologies to the Arena for such a derogatory review but I feel you need to buck up your ideas and perhaps issue some staff training if you wish to remain as a 3-star hotel!!!! In my opinion, this is nothing but a dirty youth hostel!

Room was nothing more than a broom cupboard. Bedding was worn and torn in places, window wouldn't shut, and the bathroom door creaked loudly every time it was opened. Lack of hanging space for clothes, and no chest of drawers. Soundproofing is non-existant, so were kept awake all night by two guys in the next room. Be aware than you can hear everything! Bar service was quite slow - the staff spent more time chatting to each other than serving.
reviews.title: Really poor rooms

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with a friend of mine over a friday and saturday. Like the reviewer before me, i too have returned covered in bites.
reviews.title: vile place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things started badly as i had booked a twin room but was given a double. When we complained the staff were incredibly rude and very unhelpful and tried to persuade me that even though my confirmation form said we had booked a twin they could not guarantee it. The toilet smelt disgusting and the entire room had not been cleaned before we arrived. The tiles were not properly plastered to the walls. The paint was peeling off the walls and the radiators did not work even thought it was mid winter. The beds were very thin pieces of foam and i came home with a very sore back. The carpets in the communal areas were filthy. I guess i wouldn't complain so much if it wasn't incredibly expensive for what it was. Sort it out guys, this place is a complete hole.
reviews.title: Should have picked something closer....
dirty,budget,bed bugs
reviews.text: This review is a bit dated, hopefully they have upgraded since then. My husband and I have never been to Amsterdam, and this was our first time going. I did an extensive search online to pick the perfect hotel. We didn't want to be too close to the city center, but didn't want to be too far out. I found the Hotel Arena online, and looked at the pictures. Loved the artsy and modern decor. So we booked it. After a long transatlantic flight, we arrived into Amsterdam at 9PM, and it was still light out. We found our way to the hotel by public bus. When we arrived at the hotel, it had a very goth look, with the trees shadows against the building. We walked in, the reception area was like a coat check-in for a club. Mind you it was a Friday night, and there is a nightclub on site, and they were setting up for the evenings festivities. The check-in was quite easy, they gave us keys to our room. As we proceeded down the curtain lined hall, I was just hoping that our room would be better than we thought. Took the elevator to the 6 floor, the doors creeped open and the flourescent like flickering. Not a very good vibe, open the door to the room, and found 2 twin beds on opposite side to the room and the smell was just horrid. I opened the covers on one of the bed and found stuff crawling. We immediately called the front desk, they told us the hotel was all booked, and wouldn't have an open room until the morning. We had no choice but to sleep. We didn't shower, nothing, just closed our eyes and drifted in and out of sleep all night long. Come to find out later that the hotel used to be an orphange in the early 19th century. Best thing of the hotel was the complimentary breakfast, great crossaints!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with a good friend of mine for 7 days (jan. 10-18). To say this place was a dump would be an understatement. The shower floor wasnt even curved so the water ran right out into the bathroom, The Room we were given seemed to be the worst room in the entire building. If you do plan on staying DO NOT STAY in the D section.
reviews.title: lovely hotel
Dire
reviews.text: Some more things, Hotel cleaning only came by 3 times in 7 days, I seriously doubted the cleanliness of the sheets, pillows, and towels.

reviews.title: Don't be had.
reviews.text: The photos of this hotel are seriously misleading, until you come to the tiny little thumbnail that shows a tiny, sparse room.
The building itself is indeed lovely, as are the bar and the restaurant areas, but this is where any attempt at comfort, much less luxury, ends.
reviews.title: Awful service!
good value for money
reviews.text: We had booked a superior room, and as we had arrived late, we did not have the heart to question the room we were allocated.
We happened to snatch a look inside another room on our day of departure, which we discovered was a superior room, but it has to be said, it was only a little bigger and certainly no more luxurious.
reviews.title: DON'T DO IT!!!

reviews.text: To call it 'Dutch minimalist design' is fetching it as far as it can be fetched!
reviews.title: Below Standard

reviews.text: The Arena Hotel was not my personal choice but was booked by my Dutch colleagues. Having read the reviews on Tripadvisor in advance I was a bit suspect about the place and I have to say many reviewers were right.
reviews.title: still a youth hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Arena is a very confused hotel. It does not know what it tries to be: a boutique hotel or a student dormitory. The lobby is very much eccentric boutique style hotel and reminded me of the Belfast Malmaison. That’s however were the upmarket feel ended abruptly. The staff at check in were disinterested and surly and despite requesting a smoking room gave me a non smoking room. After having to walk all the way back (and the corridors are long) I finally got the room I wanted.
reviews.title: beware!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a nut shell: it’s a YMCA room in the price of a 3-4 star hotel. A former traveler in this site took those pics which similar to what we’ve seen in our room (in the 2oo’s wing): http://www.tripadvisor.com/members/MIKeMIKeUk
reviews.title: A YMCA room in the price of a 3-4 star hotel.

likes.disliked: — Cleanness, size of room, location, staff helplessness

reviews.text: After complaining, we were upgrade to the junior suit (in the 100’s wing) which was more than O.K.
reviews.title: Thieves, bad service and small, bad rooms

likes.liked: — The common rooms are quite fancy.
likes.disliked: — Someone steals and searches luggage during the day, bad attitude from the portiers, small rooms with crappy standard, did I mention the thieves?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff, although trying, was far from being helpful. The location out of the center requires a 5 min Tram ride (no. 7 or 10).
reviews.title: Bad reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I guess one’s impression is solely depend on the location of one’s room, but hey, with such a selection of hotels in town, why even bother to take the chance?
reviews.title: As I sit in my pathetic room...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big warning for Arena Hotel! Read on!
reviews.title: worst value for money in 27 years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now i cant say the rash is from hotel arena, but I wouldnt discount the fact it very well could be. Judging on the cleanliness of the room, hotel cleaning,bathroom, pillows, towels... ALL VERY BUDGET AND VERY CHEAP AS WELL
reviews.title: Stay Away
Still like a hospital
reviews.text: WORD TO THE WISE< DO NOT STAY HERE.. Pay the extra money and stay in a quality place.. I know I will next time..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very minimalistic, our room was bare we had a bed a table and a settee ..so far so good... but then the hanging space for our clothes were very similar to school or leisure center lockers.. there was also a over bearing smell of sewage comming from our bathroom at one end from the other end (the window) was second hand smoke coming from the outside smoking area below... and the hotel seemed to be more interested in its disco/nightclub clients than the actual people who were staying there .. but another plus was you can get free earplugs so you dont hear the nightclub and the people leaving at 4am and the staff moving the outside table and chairs about.. no i wouldnt want to stay there again
reviews.title: un-impressed

reviews.text: The design of this hotel is great. A wonderful building has been redecorated in nice, designy style. The room I stayed in (and my colleagues had similar rooms) was quite special. It had two levels, with a sitting area with small desk and two arm chairs, bathroom, toilet and closet downstairs. Wonderflul, narrow stais led upstairs to the sleeping area, where you could look down to the sitting area. Windows from (almost) floor to ceiling must have been about 4 meters high. The bathroom was very, very small (more like a shower with built-in sink) and quite worn out (dirty, old hospital-like tiles, nothing special).
reviews.title: Nice design, nice breakfast, bathroom could be better

reviews.text: Breakfast room is also a good, well designed area with a buffet (fresh fruit, eggs & bacon, toast, buns, chocolate rols, croissants, cereals, fresh smoothies, coffee, tea).
reviews.title: lovely hotel! ignore the bad reviews on here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plusses:
reviews.title: sounded cool, but....
good hotel.
reviews.text: - design of hotel & rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews of this hotel before staying and thought that everyone who said it was bad was overreacting but they were not. The cafe and restaurant are really priced at a four star level and are clearly the reason that the hotel has the rating it does as the rooms are not good at all but the food in the restaurant is lovely. However, the rooms just bring this whole place down.
reviews.title: Not a three star hotel, don't stay here unless you are OK in hostel-style rooms

reviews.text: We had booked a deluxe room and were given a split level twin even though we booked a double. At first we were impressed because it was split level but then we realised it was more like a room in a hostel. The two single beds were up on one level and the TV, desk, plastic chair and really uncomfortable bench-like sofa were on the bottom level. I personally would have preferred for everything to be on one level so we could watch TV in bed but this might not be a consideration for everyone. The room had no pictures on the walls at all and the ceiling was covered in stains and in desperate need of a lick of paint. When we took the sheets off the mattresses to push them together and make a double bed, we could see that they had stains all over them including a huge one where someone had clearly wet the bed at some point. This isn't something I would expect in a three star hotel.
reviews.title: Okay, but not great; overpriced

likes.disliked: — The sleeping rooms and the restaurant service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little disappointed so I went to speak to the front desk staff on the second day to see if anything could be done. They seemed annoyed with me even though I was being polite and told me that most people liked the split level rooms. I said that it was more the two beds that had annoyed me as I was away with my boyfriend on our first holiday and we had booked a double room not a twin. They said that if I had said something the day before they would have done something but now they were fully booked, and that there might be a different room the next day if I went down to reception at 9am. All I really wanted was for them to be a little concerned, say sorry and if I couldn't be moved then give us a token for a tea or coffee in the cafe or some goodwill gesture. I don't think that's too much to ask really but they didn't even say sorry. The customer service is just non-existent. They were really unhelpful with other things as well. The vending machine with the internet access keys in it broke on the first day and it took them three days to get it fixed.
reviews.title: Love the Arena

reviews.text: This hotel is housed in a historic building which was once used as an asylum.
reviews.title: Mad and bad decision

reviews.text: And although you don't have to be completely mad to stay at the property these days, I came away rather wishing I had chosen somewhere else.
reviews.title: Never ever again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival, there were three reception staff; all of whom ignored me - preferring to continue chatting among themselves.
reviews.title: Oh dear ................

reviews.text: On my first night (of three) I decided I would give the restaurant a go, but no-one could be bothered to welcome or serve me - so I got up and went elsewhere.
reviews.title: Arena - ToAvoid

likes.liked: — Relatively close to the city centre

reviews.text: My room was spartan with white-washed walls and worst of all, smelt of drains. I complained to reception who said they would investigate - but nothing came from that.
reviews.title: Never again!

likes.disliked: — some rude staff , missing items when home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Watch out the price of the breakfast €16 ahead and nothing special
reviews.title: Ok hotel

reviews.text: The food in the restaurant was good.
reviews.title: Cool hotel

reviews.text: Accommodate was very basic and minimal, needs a lick of paint. Be prepared for a long walk or take the tram to get to Dam Square.
reviews.title: Do not stay here....

likes.liked: — I had no delay in getting a taxi away from it...
likes.disliked: — I felt like I had been tricked by the sleek, cool, funky website.

reviews.title: Run down place, worse than most youth hostels
reviews.text: The "smugness" as mentioned in a previous review came from the restaurant waiter when we asked for a table for two he replied "No! We are full!" The dining area was by no means full as far as we could see. Again the reseptionist was very helpful and directed us to Utrecht Straat were there were many different restaurants to choose from.

reviews.title: All style but no substance in Amsterdam
reviews.text: We were able to secure a booking in the hotel restaurant the following evening, well prepared and presented food but EXPENSIVE!

reviews.title: Thanks for the reviews
reviews.text: Would we go back to this hotel? Unlikely, unless they "clean up"

reviews.title: Disgrace
reviews.text: My girlfriend and i who had booked months in advance in order to guarantee a queen bed (which was confirmed) found ourselves in a tiny twin room. Reception was extremely unhelpfull and treated us with distain. It was only after contacting our travel agent in London and wasting a day that they pushed the beds together and made them up as a double. Still not what had been confirmed or we'd paid for. The walls were paper thin and it was extremely noisy, no satellite TV as promised either. i'd liken this accomodation to a trailer park. It's also in the middle of nowhere. Everytime we went to reception there were also a number of other people complaining about their rooms (un made upon arrival, broken furnishings or illigitimate phone calls charged to their account). Don't go near the place or wast your time considering it.

reviews.title: Avoid this place!
reviews.text: When I got there there was an American guy at the desk getting very Irate, he had seen three rooms, one was "a tip" the second was "small and dark" and the Third was already occupied!

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text: I thought he must just be a really fussy guy and got my card key for my room and trotted off. Well! the room they had given me was small, dingy and smelt like an old Mop. The curtains wouldn't close properly and were in any case rotting! I turned the shower on and the showerhead spun round on it's stand which could not be fixed AND the water would not drain and started to fill the shower room (all 3 foot square of it.) I'd had enough and went back to the desk, A different person was on the desk by now and seemed not at ALL suprised that I wanted to move, especially when he saw my room number. Bear in mind that I had booked the Superior double in the first place so I was wondering what the ordinary double was like.

Next room was directly over the kitchen. They stop serving food at 10:30 but carry on cleaning up, to the sound of Hip-hop played LOUD until 12:30. As I'm staying for a week this will NOT do. Also the sink had no plug and the only way to close the door was to slam it.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived at the Hotel Arena in early October with some trepidation, having booked the hotel earlier without reading the dreadful reviews posted on this site.
reviews.title: fine by us

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised therefore,when we found all staff we encountered polite, pleasant and very helpful, maybe its something to do with the manner in which the guest treats them, which brings about this miraculous change.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this one!

reviews.text: The beds were clean and comfortable, bedding clean and serviceable, walls, floors, shower room and toilet all appeared clean to our reasonable standards.
reviews.title: Devil's in the detail

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was more than adequate, plenty of choice, constantly replenished and we found no problems there at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff in bar and breakfast area pleasant and competent.
reviews.title: Not TOSTAY

likes.liked: — starirwell was nice but that was about it . and the coffee was good

reviews.text: The hotel was really nice, and good location right by the zoo. 5 minute walk to all public transportation and about 15 to 20 minute walk to any of the top tourist places to go. The service was really good and everyone would help you out with where to go in the area.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent the weekend in Amsterdam and thought the Arena was a really striking hotel - very trendy, minimalist and a very interesting mix of old and new. They did mix up the booking at the start and put us in a small twin room when we had booked an exec suite, but after an apology we got a large room which was most impressive with its vaulted high ceilings, 2 huge windows overlooking the canal, wood stripped floors and a white sheeted double bed looking very small in the middle of such a huge and bare (but as in 'mininal' not in 'bleak') room. The bathroom was okay but not that impressive. The room however was clean and well maintained, if a bit chilly.
reviews.title: Very trendy place and not a bad experience

reviews.text: The staff seemed very pleasant to me, and the breakfast we only had on one morning was very good (but don't be late it's cleared away in seconds even if you are trying to serve yourself). Whilst the hotel is a long walk from the center of town the tube is only around 5 minutes walk away and the number 9 and 14 tram run from the central station to very near the hotel.
reviews.title: Overpriced, dirty, and unhelpful staff...need I say more?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all a pleasant experience and a room and decor to remember!
reviews.title: Very poor value - give it a miss!

reviews.text: we stayed here last weekend as part of a group of girls (women) on a hen weekend to amsterdam. from start to finish this was a disappointing experience and anyone who has stayed anywhere remotely nice will find this a shock to the system. a holiday inn or a tulip would have been better... and cleaner!
reviews.title: Loved the Arena!

likes.liked: — The restaurant and bar, the decor
likes.disliked: — The hallways smelled kind of mildewy; the location was a bit far
